quoteText: The unexamined life is not worth living.
author: Socrates

quoteText: I think, therefore I am.
author: René Descartes

quoteText: Man is the measure of all things.
author: Protagoras

quoteText: He who opens a school door, closes a prison.
author: Victor Hugo

quoteText: Two things are infinite: the universe and human stupidity; and I'm not sure about the universe.
author: Albert Einstein

quoteText: That which does not kill us makes us stronger.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quoteText: Time is a flat circle.
author: Friedrich Nietzsche

quoteText: Life must be understood backward. But it must be lived forward.
author: Søren Kierkegaard

quoteText: Liberty consists in doing what one desires.
author: John Stuart Mill

quoteText: To live is the rarest thing in the world. Most people exist, that is all.
author: Oscar Wilde

quoteText: I can resist everything except temptation.
author: Oscar Wilde

quoteText: Behind every great man is a woman rolling her eyes.
author: Jim Carrey

quoteText: Before you judge a man, walk a mile in his shoes. After that, who cares? He’s a mile away and you’ve got his shoes.
author: Billy Connolly

quoteText: I’m not arguing. I’m just explaining why I’m right.
author: Unknown

quoteText: I refuse to join any club that would have me as a member.
author: Groucho Marx

quoteText: A day without sunshine is like, you know, night.
author: Steve Martin

quoteText: The road to success is always under construction.
author: Lily Tomlin

quoteText: I'm writing a book. I've got the page numbers done.
author: Steven Wright

quoteText: The difference between stupidity and genius is that genius has its limits.
author: Albert Einstein

quoteText: If you think nobody cares if you're alive, try missing a couple of payments.
author: Earl Wilson

quoteText: Do what you can, with what you have, where you are.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quoteText: Success is not final, failure is not fatal: It is the courage to continue that counts.
author: Winston Churchill

quoteText: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

quoteText: The only way to do great work is to love what you do.
author: Steve Jobs

quoteText: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

quoteText: Don’t watch the clock; do what it does. Keep going.
author: Sam Levenson

quoteText: The only limit to our realization of tomorrow is our doubts of today.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quoteText: Believe you can and you're halfway there.
author: Theodore Roosevelt

quoteText: Whether you think you can or you think you can’t, you’re right.
author: Henry Ford

quoteText: Dream big and dare to fail.
author: Norman Vaughan

quoteText: Peace comes from within. Do not seek it without.
author: Buddha

quoteText: Happiness depends upon ourselves.
author: Aristotle

quoteText: This too shall pass.
author: Persian Proverb

quoteText: When you realize nothing is lacking, the whole world belongs to you.
author: Lao Tzu

quoteText: You must be the change you wish to see in the world.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quoteText: What lies behind us and what lies before us are tiny matters compared to what lies within us.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quoteText: The only true wisdom is in knowing you know nothing.
author: Socrates

quoteText: Be yourself; everyone else is already taken.
author: Oscar Wilde

quoteText: The quieter you become, the more you can hear.
author: Ram Dass

quoteText: When you come to the end of your rope, tie a knot and hang on.
author: Franklin D. Roosevelt

quoteText: Give me liberty, or give me death!
author: Patrick Henry

quoteText: Injustice anywhere is a threat to justice everywhere.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quoteText: You miss 100% of the shots you don’t take.
author: Wayne Gretzky

quoteText: Power tends to corrupt, and absolute power corrupts absolutely.
author: Lord Acton

quoteText: The future belongs to those who prepare for it today.
author: Malcolm X

quoteText: The price of anything is the amount of life you exchange for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quoteText: The most courageous act is still to think for yourself. Aloud.
author: Coco Chanel

quoteText: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

quoteText: Not everything that is faced can be changed, but nothing can be changed until it is faced.
author: James Baldwin

quoteText: Creativity is intelligence having fun.
author: Albert Einstein

quoteText: It is not length of life, but depth of life.
author: Ralph Waldo Emerson

quoteText: Life is what happens when you're busy making other plans.
author: John Lennon

quoteText: Get busy living or get busy dying.
author: Stephen King

quoteText: You only live once, but if you do it right, once is enough.
author: Mae West

quoteText: The purpose of our lives is to be happy.
author: Dalai Lama

quoteText: Turn your wounds into wisdom.
author: Oprah Winfrey

quoteText: Life is really simple, but we insist on making it complicated.
author: Confucius

quoteText: Love the life you live. Live the life you love.
author: Bob Marley

quoteText: Keep smiling, because life is a beautiful thing and there's so much to smile about.
author: Marilyn Monroe

quoteText: Do not take life too seriously. You will never get out of it alive.
author: Elbert Hubbard

quoteText: If you tell the truth, you don't have to remember anything.
author: Mark Twain

quoteText: A journey of a thousand miles begins with a single step.
author: Lao Tzu

quoteText: Wisely, and slow. They stumble that run fast.
author: William Shakespeare

quoteText: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

quoteText: The mind is everything. What you think you become.
author: Buddha

quoteText: Success usually comes to those who are too busy to be looking for it.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quoteText: Don’t be afraid to give up the good to go for the great.
author: John D. Rockefeller

quoteText: I find that the harder I work, the more luck I seem to have.
author: Thomas Jefferson

quoteText: Opportunities don't happen. You create them.
author: Chris Grosser

quoteText: Success is not in what you have, but who you are.
author: Bo Bennett

quoteText: Try not to become a man of success, but rather try to become a man of value.
author: Albert Einstein

quoteText: What would you do if you weren't afraid?
author: Sheryl Sandberg

quoteText: Happiness is not something ready made. It comes from your own actions.
author: Dalai Lama

quoteText: Success is how high you bounce when you hit bottom.
author: George S. Patton

quoteText: Success is walking from failure to failure with no loss of enthusiasm.
author: Winston Churchill

quoteText: Don’t wait. The time will never be just right.
author: Napoleon Hill

quoteText: We generate fears while we sit. We overcome them by action.
author: Dr. Henry Link

quoteText: If you want to achieve greatness stop asking for permission.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Everything you’ve ever wanted is on the other side of fear.
author: George Addair

quoteText: Hardships often prepare ordinary people for an extraordinary destiny.
author: C.S. Lewis

quoteText: You are never too old to set another goal or to dream a new dream.
author: C.S. Lewis

quoteText: Success isn’t about how much money you make, it’s about the difference you make in people’s lives.
author: Michelle Obama

quoteText: Everything has beauty, but not everyone sees it.
author: Confucius

quoteText: Nothing will work unless you do.
author: Maya Angelou

quoteText: I've failed over and over and over again in my life and that is why I succeed.
author: Michael Jordan

quoteText: The best revenge is massive success.
author: Frank Sinatra

quoteText: Act as if what you do makes a difference. It does.
author: William James

quoteText: Do one thing every day that scares you.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: It’s never too late to be what you might’ve been.
author: George Eliot

quoteText: If opportunity doesn’t knock, build a door.
author: Milton Berle

quoteText: Your time is limited, so don’t waste it living someone else’s life.
author: Steve Jobs

quoteText: It does not matter how slowly you go as long as you do not stop.
author: Confucius

quoteText: Dreaming, after all, is a form of planning.
author: Gloria Steinem

quoteText: Only those who will risk going too far can possibly find out how far one can go.
author: T.S. Eliot

quoteText: The harder you work for something, the greater you'll feel when you achieve it.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Little minds are tamed and subdued by misfortune; but great minds rise above them.
author: Washington Irving

quoteText: It is during our darkest moments that we must focus to see the light.
author: Aristotle

quoteText: When one door of happiness closes, another opens.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: Don’t count the days, make the days count.
author: Muhammad Ali

quoteText: Action is the foundational key to all success.
author: Pablo Picasso

quoteText: Go confidently in the direction of your dreams! Live the life you’ve imagined.
author: Henry David Thoreau

quoteText: A person who never made a mistake never tried anything new.
author: Albert Einstein

quoteText: Never let the fear of striking out keep you from playing the game.
author: Babe Ruth

quoteText: Whether you think you can or you think you can’t, you’re right.
author: Henry Ford

quoteText: Everything you can imagine is real.
author: Pablo Picasso

quoteText: Do what you feel in your heart to be right – for you’ll be criticized anyway.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: I have not failed. I've just found 10,000 ways that won't work.
author: Thomas Edison

quoteText: Success is not how high you have climbed, but how you make a positive difference to the world.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quoteText: Believe in yourself. You are braver than you think, more talented than you know, and capable of more than you imagine.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quoteText: Start where you are. Use what you have. Do what you can.
author: Arthur Ashe

quoteText: What we think, we become.
author: Buddha

quoteText: Success is not the key to happiness. Happiness is the key to success.
author: Albert Schweitzer

quoteText: Don’t let yesterday take up too much of today.
author: Will Rogers

quoteText: It always seems impossible until it’s done.
author: Nelson Mandela

quoteText: A goal without a plan is just a wish.
author: Antoine de Saint-Exupéry

quoteText: You don’t have to be great to start, but you have to start to be great.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: The way to get started is to quit talking and begin doing.
author: Walt Disney

quoteText: What you get by achieving your goals is not as important as what you become by achieving your goals.
author: Zig Ziglar

quoteText: Either you run the day, or the day runs you.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: Quality means doing it right when no one is looking.
author: Henry Ford

quoteText: It’s not whether you get knocked down, it’s whether you get up.
author: Vince Lombardi

quoteText: Your limitation—it's only your imagination.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Push yourself, because no one else is going to do it for you.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Sometimes later becomes never. Do it now.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Great things never come from comfort zones.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Dream it. Wish it. Do it.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Stay focused and never give up.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Work hard in silence, let your success be your noise.
author: Frank Ocean

quoteText: The best time to plant a tree was 20 years ago. The second best time is now.
author: Chinese Proverb

quoteText: Don’t be pushed around by the fears in your mind. Be led by the dreams in your heart.
author: Roy T. Bennett

quoteText: Don’t limit your challenges. Challenge your limits.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Magic is believing in yourself. If you can make that happen, you can make anything happen.
author: Johann Wolfgang von Goethe

quoteText: Doubt kills more dreams than failure ever will.
author: Suzy Kassem

quoteText: Learn as if you will live forever, live like you will die tomorrow.
author: Mahatma Gandhi

quoteText: If you are not willing to risk the usual, you will have to settle for the ordinary.
author: Jim Rohn

quoteText: The only place where success comes before work is in the dictionary.
author: Vidal Sassoon

quoteText: The best way to predict the future is to invent it.
author: Alan Kay

quoteText: If you can dream it, you can do it.
author: Walt Disney

quoteText: Work until your idols become your rivals.
author: Drake

quoteText: Perseverance is not a long race; it is many short races one after another.
author: Walter Elliot

quoteText: You don’t need to see the whole staircase, just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quoteText: Great minds discuss ideas; average minds discuss events; small minds discuss people.
author: Eleanor Roosevelt

quoteText: When something is important enough, you do it even if the odds are not in your favor.
author: Elon Musk

quoteText: What you do today can improve all your tomorrows.
author: Ralph Marston

quoteText: You are the artist of your own life. Don’t hand the paintbrush to anyone else.
author: Unknown

quoteText: Be so good they can’t ignore you.
author: Steve Martin

quoteText: You don't have to see the whole path. Just take the first step.
author: Martin Luther King Jr.

quoteText: Be a voice, not an echo.
author: Albert Einstein

quoteText: When you have a dream, you've got to grab it and never let go.
author: Carol Burnett

quoteText: Never bend your head. Always hold it high. Look the world straight in the eye.
author: Helen Keller

quoteText: The more a thing tends to be permanent, the more it tends to be lifeless.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: You are an aperture through which the universe is looking at and exploring itself.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: The menu is not the meal.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: A person who thinks all the time has nothing to think about except thoughts.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: Things are as they are. Looking out into the universe at night, we make no comparisons between right and wrong stars, nor between well and badly arranged constellations.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: You didn’t come into this world. You came out of it, like a wave from the ocean.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: Problems that remain persistently insoluble should always be suspected as questions asked in the wrong way.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: Trying to escape fear only makes it worse. You must face it and let it dissolve.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: Faith is a state of openness or trust.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: Zen does not confuse spirituality with thinking about God while one is peeling potatoes. Zen spirituality is just to peel the potatoes.
author: Alan Watts

quoteText: Act without expectation.
author: Laozi

quoteText: Be content with what you have; rejoice in the way things are.
author: Laozi

quoteText: Those who know do not speak. Those who speak do not know.
author: Laozi

quoteText: Nature does not hurry, yet everything is accomplished.
author: Laozi

quoteText: Silence is a source of great strength.
author: Laozi

quoteText: He who conquers himself is the mightiest warrior.
author: Confucius

quoteText: Respect yourself and others will respect you.
author: Confucius

quoteText: The man who moves a mountain begins by carrying away small stones.
author: Confucius

quoteText: Virtue alone is not enough to govern a nation; there must be rules and order.
author: Confucius

quoteText: Forget injuries, never forget kindnesses.
author: Confucius

quoteText: Beware the barrenness of a busy life.
author: Socrates

quoteText: Wonder is the beginning of wisdom.
author: Socrates

quoteText: Contentment is natural wealth, luxury is artificial poverty.
author: Socrates

quoteText: Be kind, for everyone you meet is fighting a hard battle.
author: Plato

quoteText: Only the dead have seen the end of war.
author: Plato

quoteText: Music gives a soul to the universe, wings to the mind, flight to the imagination.
author: Plato

quoteText: You can discover more about a person in an hour of play than in a year of conversation.
author: Plato

quoteText: Thinking is the talking of the soul with itself.
author: Plato

quoteText: We are what we repeatedly do. Excellence, then, is not an act, but a habit.
author: Aristotle

quoteText: Patience is bitter, but its fruit is sweet.
author: Aristotle

quoteText: Educating the mind without educating the heart is no education at all.
author: Aristotle

quoteText: All human beings, by nature, desire to know.
author: Aristotle

quoteText: Happiness is the meaning and the purpose of life, the whole aim and end of human existence.
author: Aristotle

quoteText: The wealth required by nature is limited and is easy to procure; but the wealth required by vain ideals extends to infinity.
author: Epicurus

quoteText: Death does not concern us, because as long as we exist, death is not here. And when it does come, we no longer exist.
author: Epicurus

quoteText: Do not spoil what you have by desiring what you have not.
author: Epicurus

quoteText: He who is not satisfied with a little is satisfied with nothing.
author: Epicurus

quoteText: It is impossible to live a pleasant life without living wisely and well and justly.
author: Epicurus

quoteText: Character is destiny.
author: Heraclitus

quoteText: Eyes and ears are bad witnesses to people if they have souls that understand not their language.
author: Heraclitus

quoteText: There is a harmony in the bending of the bow and the strumming of the lyre.
author: Heraclitus

quoteText: Opposition brings concord. Out of discord comes the fairest harmony.
author: Heraclitus

quoteText: The sun is new every day.
author: Heraclitus

quoteText: The greatest victory is that which requires no battle.
author: Sun Tzu

quoteText: He will win who knows when to fight and when not to fight.
author: Sun Tzu

quoteText: To know your Enemy, you must become your Enemy.
author: Sun Tzu

quoteText: In the midst of chaos, there is also opportunity.
author: Sun Tzu

quoteText: The wise warrior avoids the battle.
author: Sun Tzu

quoteText: Appear weak when you are strong, and strong when you are weak.
author: Sun Tzu

quoteText: Know yourself and you will win all battles.
author: Sun Tzu
